name: Rhinoceros Hornbill
description: The Rhinoceros Hornbill is a large bird with a distinctive upturned casque, revered in some cultures.
spread_note: Found in Borneo, Sumatra, and the Malay Peninsula.
food_note: Important for forest ecosystems as seed dispersers.
reproduction: Females seal themselves in tree cavities to lay 1-2 eggs, incubation about 40 days.
attractions: A star attraction in zoos due to their striking casque and behaviors.
projects_note: Threatened by deforestation; conservation efforts focus on habitat protection.
breeding: Rarely bred in captivity due to specific nesting requirements.
